DOC.brief_title: Improving Nutritional Outcomes Among Food Insecure Twin Cities Residents
DOC.detailed_description: Food insecurity disproportionately affect low-income , minority , foreign-born family , result disproportionate burden nutrition-related chronic condition affect group . In Minnesota , half million food insecure family rely food shelf ( also know food pantry ) emergency food assistance 2009 . Yet reliance food shelf culturally diverse population may present nutritional challenge two main reason . First , unlike many food assistance program ( e.g. , school nutritional program , WIC ) , currently exist standard nutritional quality food shelf offering . Inventory data collect sample Twin Cities food shelf summer 2012 begin identity priority area improvement nutritional quality food shelf item , recommendation yet implement . Second , secure healthy meal large population immigrant refugees family rely food shelf Twin Cities may particularly challenge . Among client , unfamiliarity `` American '' food cook practice food affordable available may serve barrier healthy meal preparation . Very little research examine potential cooking skill incorporation new food improve dietary outcome among group culturally diverse food insecure family . Recognizing nutritional outcome drive influence food system level individual level , long-term goal research improve nutritional outcome among food insecure family enhancements food shelf level client level . Because complexity make systemic improvement quality emergency food supply , pilot study conduct formative research improve food supply food shelf level , primarily focus test strategy improve nutrition-related behavior client level . This intervention focus primarily promote cook skill use healthy `` American '' item along culturally appropriate ingredient . Cooking class occur partnership Cooking Mattersâ„¢ program , lead hands-on 6-week cooking base nutrition education program variety venue great Twin Cities area , conduct University Minnesota Extension .
